As they note, a line of poplars planted in 1903 by John Henry Buxton on his estate in Ware, Hertfordshire, seems not to have had any connection with marking e­ ither the prime meridian or the observatory. I have not included it ­here in noting the ten forms of prime meridian commemoration between 1910 and 1959.
